defect.para: This Recall applies to AmTran RE, AmTran FE, GENESIS, AmTran Conventional and AmTran/Ward Volunteer buses built from June 3, 1992 through February 24, 1999.

American Transportation Corporation (AmTran) has determined that a defect relating to motor vehicle safety exists in some AmTran RE™, AmTran FE™, GENESIS™, AmTran Conventional™ and AmTran/Ward Volunteer buses. This defect involves the flip seats located at the side emergency doors.

Some of the above buses were built with flip seats that can cause injury when being deployed to the sitting position. The seat cushion hinge located on the aisle side of our standard flip seat is located close to the edge of the seat and within reach of the passenger. The two halves of the hinge assembly pass near each other creating a scissors action. The seat cushion hinge on our combination flip seat is located in such a manner that it is within easy reach of the passenger seated in the seat located behind the combo flip seat. The hinges on the combo flip seat could cause a pinching condition. These defects could result in personal injury.
Owners are being notified of this recall and have been directed to contact an AmTran Alliance dealer to make arrangements for inspection and remedy of the defect.

svcproc.title: INSPECTION
svcproc.para: There are several different flip seats available and are located in different locations within the bus. To make sure that we send you the correct kit or kits to remedy the above issue, we are asking you to document on your "AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card, the type and location of flip seats in this unit. We have records on this unit identifying the seats that were installed at the time of manufacture, but need to verify the flip seat information. Refer to the Figures below.

item.para: Figure 1 shows the typical standard automatic flip seat located adjacent to the left side (driver's side) emergency door and requires type "A" kit.
Figure 2 shows the typical standard automatic flip seat located adjacent to the right side (opposite from the driver's side) emergency door and requires type "B" kit.

Figure 3 shows the special automatic flip seat located adjacent to the right side (opposite from the driver's side) emergency door located at the most rear position at the engine compartment and requires type "C" kit. This is available only on AmTran RE products.
Figure 4 shows the combination automatic flip seat located adjacent to the left side (driver's side) emergency door and requires type "D" kit.

svcproc.para: Typical Standard flip seat located on the left side of the bus. Requires Type "A" kit.
Typical standard flip seat located on the right side of the bus between the wheel pockets on all models or behind the rear wheel pocket on all models except AmTran RE. Requires Type "B" kit.
Right side flip seat located behind the rear wheel pocket just in front of the engine compartment on AmTran RE buses only. Requires Type "C" kit.
Combination flip seat showing unique wider rear seat back versus the narrow seat. Requires Type "D" kit.

Please complete and return the "AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card checking one of the boxes, #1 through #6 or box #8. When checking box #8 enter the type of kit(s) required. Therefore, if you require only the left standard flip seat kit, enter "A" in the (_). Example: SEND TYPE (A) KIT. If you require both the left and right standard flip seat kit enter "A" in the (__) on the first line and "B" in the (__) on the second line. Example: SEND TYPE (A) KIT. SEND TYPE (B) KIT.
Normally only the type "A" kit is required except for those units that have two flip seats or a special combination seat as depicted by the Figures.

step1.para: All flip seats except for the combination flip seat will require a modesty panel be installed on the aisle side of the seat. The combination flip seat will require a modesty panel mounted under the seat cushion frame. Kits with parts and instructions are available to make the repair.
Complete and install the "Campaign Identification Label" (see instructions below) that is included in the kit.
Complete and return the owner's postage-paid "Recall - Repair Reply Card" that is included in the kit. This card is included with left side and combination seats only.

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner's vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his or her vehicle as soon as possible.
